definition: to act rashly/to act precipitously regardless of the consequences/reckless/foolhardy/daredevil
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: You always go at a job bald-headed.
sentences.chinese: 你總是對工作不思後果地蠻幹。

sentences.english: You look pretty busy today. Do you have an opening for me?
sentences.chinese: 你的頭髮看起來蠻幹的，還有分叉。

sentences.english: Your hair seems quite dry, you know. And I see some split ends.
sentences.chinese: 你的頭髮看起來蠻幹的，還有分叉。

sentences.english: If you act rashly， you'll suffer for it.
To an extent, debugging through deduction is a brute-force approach.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，通過推論進行調試是一種蠻幹的做法。

sentences.english: You should get rid of your foolhardiness.
sentences.chinese: 你必須改掉你的蠻幹作風。

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
